numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed a pattern.
2. Students with a higher income were more likely to be admitted.
3. Students with legacy parents were more likely to be admitted.
4. There are several possible factors.
5. Some higher-income families do not require scholarships.
6. Some higher-income families have access to more tutoring.
7. Some higher-income families have access to more educational resources.
8. More tutoring and more educational resources can cause better grades.
9. Better grades can increase the likelihood of admission.
10. Some higher-income families are more likely to give more money to the school.
11. These reasons should not cause an equally hard-working student to not be admitted.
12. This other student has fewer resources.
13. This other student has fewer connections.
14. This other student has less money.
15. This other student has the same intelligence.
16. Unfortunately, this is not the case.
17. Statistics can be skewed easily.
18. Data is hard to collect with 100% accuracy.
19. We do not know the exact statistics.
20. We do not know all factors that influence these admission decisions.
